content: sweet oddity art milton the mosasaurus crochet pattern https //www etsy com/shop/sweetoddityart copyright 2022 of sweet oddity art you are not allowed to sell this pattern you are not allowed to distribute or publish this pattern in any form you are not allowed to alter this pattern in any form sweet oddity art 1 pattern details size 28 inches from tail to tip of nose with weight 5 yarn and a 5 00 mm hook skill level needed intermediate- suitable for novice crocheters requires patience and precisions when assembling the dinosaur and basic crochet skills contact info if you have any questions or concerns about this pattern please do not hesitate to contact me i will get back to you within 24 hours sweetoddityart@gmail com https //www etsy com/shop/sweetoddityart materials needed yarn bulky weight yarn #5 premier parfait color a blue color b pink color c teal hook size h hook or 5 00 mm 25 mm safety eyes scissors sewing needle stitch marker fiberfill stuffing abbreviations magic_ring= magic_ring- crochet single_crochet stitches in to the adjustable loop blo= back loops only chain= chain stitch f/o= fasten_off single_crochet= single_crochet stitch half_double_crochet= half_double_crochet sl= slip_stitch flo= front loops only double_crochet= double_crochet stitch inc3= 3 single_crochet in the same stitch increase= increase- make two single_crochet stitches in the same stitch decrease=decrease- crochet two stitches together using the decrease method 4 single_crochet increase x 6= repeat the pattern between parentheses 6 times notes do not join rounds unless stated work in a continuous spiral use a stitch marker to mark the beginning of each round all stitches are worked in both loops unless stated otherwise in the pattern sweet oddity art 2 head and body crocheted from front of head to back with color a 1 make 6 single_crochet into a magic_ring= 6 2 increase in each st around= 12 3 increase x 3 3 single_crochet x 2= 18 4 increase x 3 6 single_crochet x 2= 24 5-7 single_crochet in each st around 8 increase 11 single_crochet x 2= 26 9-10 single_crochet in each st around 11 increase 12 single_crochet x 2= 28 12-13 single_crochet in each st around 14 increase 13 single_crochet x 2= 30 15-16 single_crochet in each st around *mark the 2nd increase in round 17 with a stitch marker* 17 4 single_crochet increase x 6= 36 18 5 single_crochet increase x 6= 42 19 6 single_crochet increase x 6= 48 20-23 single_crochet in each st around place eyes between rounds 17 and 18 leaving 14 holes between them place the 1st eye before the 2nd increase count 14 holes after that and place the 2nd eye if you want the sunken eye look do not place the backs of the eyes on until round 31 24 6 single_crochet decrease x 6= 42 25-26 single_crochet in each st around 27 5 single_crochet decrease x 6= 36 28-31 single_crochet in each st around now for the eyes stuff the head well cut a long piece of yarn and remove the eyes
